news_header: NATO ministers are set to discuss Ukraine's plan for NATO membership amid ongoing conflict with Russia.
news_text: On Thursday night, NATO ministers will review Ukraine's victory plan, with Ukrainian President Volodymir Zelenskyi advocating for swift NATO membership. Zelenskyi presented this plan to EU leaders and NATO defense ministers, emphasizing the importance of joining NATO for Ukraine's security. NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte affirmed that Ukraine will eventually become a member, although an invitation may not be immediate. Zelenskyi highlighted that Ukraine has no alternative but to pursue NATO membership, especially after giving up its nuclear weapons in the 1990s in exchange for security assurances. The ongoing Russian aggression underscores the urgency of Ukraine's NATO aspirations.
